title: Auburn running back JaTarvious Whitlow out 4-6 weeks after knee surgery
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: USA TODAY Sports' Paul Myerberg provides his opinion of the top three programs in the history of college football. USA TODAY

AUBURN, Ala. — JaTarvious "Boobee" Whitlow, Auburn's leading rusher this season, will miss the next four to six weeks after undergoing knee surgery on Tuesday, head coach Gus Malzahn announced.

The sophomore suffered a knee injury late in Saturday's 24-13 loss at Florida.

Whitlow ranks second in the SEC with 544 rushing yards on 110 carries through six games this season. He also leads the league with seven rushing touchdowns.

Malzahn said the bye week would be big for true freshman D.J. Williams.

More to come.

Josh Vitale is the Auburn beat writer for the Montgomery Advertiser. You can follow him on Twitter at @JoshVitale.
description: JaTarvious "Boobee" Whitlow, the SEC's second-leading rusher and touchdown leader, will miss 4-6 weeks for Auburn after undergoing knee surgery.
